content:
Hi there,
I have migrated a site to backdrop from Drupal 7 and have user accounts with an image field.
If I remove the image and hit Save or if I upload af new image and hit Save it return the following error:

EntityStorageException: SQLSTATE[42S02]: Base table or view not found: 1146 Table 'intranet_bd.field_data_field_image' doesn't exist i EntityDatabaseStorageController->save() (linje 676 af /usr/www/users/superej/intranet_bd/core/modules/entity/entity.controller.inc).

Hope somebody can help. :-)

Ooops, not sure if I can help. The field's database table seems to be missing. Hm... field_data_field_image - isn't that one of the fields, Backdrop ships with by default? Is field_image the name of the field you're trying to delete? Does field_image still exist, when visiting the field UI?

Hi, Søren Bonde. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU

indigoxela said:

Ooops, not sure if I can help. The field's database table seems to be missing. Hm... field_data_field_image - isn't that one of the fields, Backdrop ships with by default? Is field_image the name of the field you're trying to delete? Does field_image still exist, when visiting the field UI?

Thanks for your reply. :-)
The field_data_field_image doesn't exist it is called field_data_field_billede.
So it seems like Backdrop got the wrong system name for the image field imported from the Drupal 7 database.
@Søren Bonde does a file named field.field.field_image.json exist in your config directory? That should be in a directory named like files/config_ae3eclooonghashhere/active
@indigoxela yes it does, should I remove it or edit the file and point it to field_billede instead?
@Søren Bonde I wouldn't recommend that. Another question: what other field json files do you have in the config directory? Anything that starts with field.field.and field.instance.

@indigoxela yes I do, there is quite a few field.field and field.instance.
Looks like there is one for each fields from the Drupal 7 site.

Did your Drupal site have a field_image anyway? I guess, you followed this instruction: https://backdropcms.org/upgrade-from-drupal

If your Drupal didn't have a field named field_image and the database table doesn't exist now, but the config exists, ... I suspect it's the default field that ships with Backdrop on install (attached to node type "post").

If you do not need it anyway for your upgraded Drupal, you better delete it in Backdrop before you switch the database to your Drupal db. Hope this helps, I'm guessing a lot here...

@indigoxela No it didn't have field_image.
Yes I followed the instructions you mentioned.

Ok, will try and delete it before switching database and do another import.

Thanks for you help! :-)

@indigoxela I manually imported the missing field_image tables from a clean Backdrop install and removed the field form the UI. That solved the problem. :-)
Thanks a lot for all your help! :-)
I ended up getting all other kinds of strange errors regarding the Logintoboggan module after I solved the image field issue, but uninstalled the module for now.
